item.title: 马斯克旗下SpaceX与xAI以1.25万亿美元估值完成合并，美国航天股应声上涨
item.description: 周二，美国航天类股上涨，此前埃隆·马斯克宣布SpaceX与xAI合并，该交易对合并后实体的估值达1.25万亿美元，此举将大力推动地球外人工智能基础设施的建设。【原文：U.S. space stocks rose on Tuesday after Elon Musk announced the merger of SpaceX and xAI in a deal that valued the combined entity at $1.25 trillion, a major push to expand artificial intelligence infrastructure outside earth.】

item.title: 标普、纳斯达克期货小幅走高，财报洪流成为市场焦点
item.description: 追踪标普500指数和纳斯达克指数的期货周二小幅走高，在震荡交投后趋稳，因投资者为本周即将公布的大量企业财报做准备。【原文：Futures tracking the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq edged higher on Tuesday, steadying after a choppy session, as investors geared up for a flood of corporate results due this week.】

item.title: 贵金属价格波动或将考验快速增长的黄金代币市场
item.description: 金价飙升正推动所谓代币化黄金的需求，这一数字资产市场的快速增长领域，专家警告称其存在托管和监管风险，而这些风险对投资者而言往往并不明显。【原文：A surge in the price of gold is driving demand for so-called tokenized gold, a fast-growing niche of the digital asset market, which experts warn carries custody and regulatory risks that are not always apparent to investors.】

item.title: 百事公司季度营收超预期，得益于碳酸饮料需求韧性
item.description: 百事公司周二公布的第四季度营收超出预期，得益于其碳酸饮料在国际市场的强劲需求，以及在美国市场低糖饮料的良好表现。【原文：PepsiCo topped fourth-quarter revenue expectations on Tuesday, benefiting from robust demand for its sodas in international markets, as well as strength in its low-sugar beverages in the U.S.】

item.title: 奈飞联合首席执行官因华纳兄弟交易案遭美国参议院委员会严厉质询
item.description: 网飞联合首席执行官泰德·萨兰多斯将于周二在美国参议院听证会上接受质询，焦点在于该公司拟以827亿美元收购华纳兄弟探索公司的交易将如何影响流媒体娱乐行业的竞争格局。【原文：Netflix Co-Chief Executive Officer Ted Sarandos faces a grilling in the U.S. Senate on Tuesday at a hearing over how his company's proposed $82.7 billion acquisition of Warner Bros Discovery will affect competition in the streaming entertainment industry.】

item.title: 韩国Bitsensing推出驾驶员辅助系统，车队寻求安全升级
item.description: 韩国雷达初创企业Bitsensing周二宣布推出面向巴士和卡车的先进驾驶辅助系统套件，旨在为现有商用车队加装安全技术，以降低事故风险和运营成本。【原文：Bitsensing has launched an advanced driver-assistance system kit for buses and trucks, the South Korean radar startup said on Tuesday, aiming to retrofit existing commercial vehicle fleets with safety tech to cut accident risks and operating costs.】

item.title: 独家报道：尽管实施了新限制，埃隆·马斯克旗下的Grok系统仍会生成性化图像——即便被告知相关主体未予同意
item.description: 路透社发现，埃隆·马斯克旗下的旗舰人工智能聊天机器人Grok，即使用户明确警告被描绘对象未同意，仍会持续生成人物的性化图像。【原文：Elon Musk’s flagship artificial intelligence chatbot, Grok, continues to generate sexualized images of people even when users explicitly warn that the subjects do not consent, Reuters has found.】

item.title: 西门子能源将在美国电力市场投入10亿美元
item.description: 西门子能源计划投资10亿美元，扩大美国电网及燃气轮机部件的生产规模，以满足该国建设人工智能技术所需数据中心的需求。【原文：Siemens Energy plans to invest $1 billion to expand U.S. power grid and gas turbine component production as the country builds data centres needed to power AI technology.】

item.title: 美国券商可能向ETF管理公司收取费用，因免佣金交易造成损失
item.description: 摩根大通表示，美国经纪商和托管机构或将向交易所交易基金（ETF）管理人收取分销费，这标志着该国规模达13.5万亿美元的ETF市场可能迎来重大变革。【原文：U.S. brokerage firms and custodians may seek distribution fees from managers of exchange-traded funds, J.P. Morgan said, marking a possible crucial shift in the country's $13.5 trillion ETF market.】

item.title: 法国检察官为何调查埃隆·马斯克的X平台？
item.description: 法国检察官周二表示，他们正在扩大对埃隆·马斯克旗下社交媒体平台X的调查范围，并已传唤这位科技界亿万富翁于四月接受问询。【原文：French prosecutors said on Tuesday they were widening an investigation into Elon Musk's social media platform X and that they have summoned the tech billionaire for questioning in April.】

item.title: 阿联酋官员称，与马斯克旗下The Boring Company合作的迪拜环线项目第一阶段将立即启动
item.description: 阿联酋官员周二表示，由埃隆·马斯克的The Boring Company公司承建的迪拜环线项目第一阶段——地下高速交通网络——即将启动建设。【原文：The first phase of the Dubai Loop project, an underground high-speed transport network, to be build by Elon Musk’s Boring Company is set to start immediately, a UAE official said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普关税下调令印度松一口气，尽管细节寥寥
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普宣布与印度达成贸易协议，将关税从50%降至18%，作为交换条件，印度政府需停止购买俄罗斯石油并降低贸易壁垒。【原文：President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with India to cut tariffs to 18% from 50% in exchange for New Delhi halting Russian oil purchases and lowering trade barriers.】

item.title: 巴黎检察官网络犯罪部门搜查马斯克旗下X公司法国办公室
item.description: 巴黎检察官办公室表示，作为2025年1月启动的一项调查的一部分，搜查行动正在进行中。【原文：The Paris prosecutor's office said a search was underway as part of an investigation opened in January 2025.】

item.title: 劳斯莱斯为定价辩护，此前多家航空公司抨击发动机行业
item.description: 周二，劳斯莱斯一位高管为近期涨价及性能提升进行了辩护，此前多家航空公司指责发动机制造商利用供应链问题牟利。【原文：A senior Rolls-Royce executive on Tuesday defended recent price rises and improvements in performance after airlines accused engine makers of profiting from supply chain problems.】

item.title: 新加坡航展在供应链紧张、区域需求激增中拉开帷幕
item.description: 亚洲规模最大的航空盛会拉开帷幕，尽管供应链普遍短缺导致多架飞机交付延迟，但业界仍致力于实现雄心勃勃的区域增长目标。【原文：Asia's biggest aviation gathering kicked off with the industry looking to meet ambitious regional growth targets despite widespread supply chain shortages that have delayed many aircraft deliveries.】

item.title: 印美贸易协定大幅削减关税；预计将提振出口和市场情绪
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普宣布与印度达成贸易协议，将美国对印度商品的关税从50%削减至18%，作为交换，印度将停止购买俄罗斯石油并降低贸易壁垒。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with India that slashes U.S. tariffs on Indian goods to 18% from 50% in exchange for India halting Russian oil purchases and lowering trade barriers.】

item.title: 德国计划在军事太空领域大举投入，瞄准激光武器和间谍卫星
item.description: 德国太空司令部指挥官表示，德国正考虑投资350亿欧元（约合410亿美元）的军事太空计划，涵盖从间谍卫星、太空飞机到攻击性激光武器等项目，旨在应对来自俄罗斯和中国在轨道空间日益增长的威胁。【原文：Germany is weighing investments ranging from spy satellites and space planes to offensive lasers under a 35 billion euro ($41 billion) military space spending plan aimed at countering growing threats from Russia and China in orbit, the country's space commander said.】

item.title: 日本任天堂维持年度利润，硬件预测
item.description: 日本任天堂公司周二维持其年度营业利润预测为3700亿日元（约合24亿美元），较上一财年增长近三分之一。【原文：Japan's Nintendo on Tuesday maintained its annual operating profit forecast of 370 billion yen ($2.4 billion), an increase of nearly a third over the previous financial year.】

item.title: 空客首席执行官称供应链面临挑战
item.description: 空中客车公司首席执行官纪尧姆·福里周二表示，该公司供应链面临重大挑战，积压待交付的飞机数量庞大。【原文：Airbus has faced significant challenges in its supply chain with a backlog of aircraft to deliver, CEO Guillaume Faury said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日本首相关于日元贬值的闲谈令财政官僚们措手不及
item.description: 就在日本终于在遏制日元急剧贬值的漫长艰苦斗争中取得进展之际，其首相却抛出新的挑战——他即兴的言论对日元疲软给出了另一种解读。【原文：Just as Japan was finally gaining ground in its long, hard fight to stop sharp currency falls, a fresh challenge has emerged from its own prime minister, whose off-the-cuff comments tell a different story about yen weakness.】

item.title: 世通科技初步业绩超预期，但警示2026年将走弱
item.description: 德国半导体晶圆供应商世创电子周二公布初步第四季度业绩，其核心利润和营收均超出市场预期。【原文：German semiconductor wafer supplier Siltronic on Tuesday reported preliminary fourth-quarter results with core profit and revenue beating market expectations.】

item.title: 安盛投资管理业绩超预期，CEO称客户寻求美元避险
item.description: 欧洲最大资产管理公司安盛投资管理周二公布，其第四季度净流入资金超出预期。该公司首席执行官表示，客户正寻求在欧洲实现多元化配置，并减少美元资产持有。【原文：Europe's largest asset manager, Amundi , on Tuesday reported higher-than-expected net inflows in the fourth-quarter, and the CEO said clients were seeking diversification in Europe and away from the U.S. dollar.】

item.title: 从"完美契合"到告别：价格保证如何促成皮诺退出彪马
item.description: 弗朗索瓦-亨利·皮诺上周以18亿美元将家族持有的彪马控股权出售给中国安踏时，或许未能如愿以偿。但据两位知情人士透露，这笔交易附带一项关键条款：一项"避免难堪"的保密协议。【原文：François-Henri Pinault may not have got as much as he wanted when he sold his family's controlling stake in Puma to China's Anta for $1.8 billion last week. But, according to two sources close to the matter, the deal came with a deal-sealing sweetener: an "anti-embarrassment" clause.】

item.title: 早盘行情：特朗普取消印度协议，澳大利亚加息
item.description: 汤姆·韦斯特布鲁克带您展望欧洲及全球市场今日走势【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 顶级咨询公司通过中国业务变通方案挑战边界
item.description: 面对充满挑战的地缘政治环境，全球咨询公司正转向更具风险的在华经营方式。一些行业和法律专家指出，这些做法正在挑战西方制裁的边界，同时也触及北京限制外国企业涉足敏感领域的政策底线。【原文：Faced with a fraught geopolitical environment, global consultancies are turning to riskier ways to do business in China that some industry and legal experts say test the boundaries of Western sanctions and Beijing's drive to curb foreign involvement in sensitive sectors.】

item.title: 印度同意从美国购买石油、国防产品和飞机，官方称
item.description: 印度政府官员周二向路透社透露，印度已同意根据一项贸易协议，从美国购买石油、国防产品、电子产品、医药和电信产品以及飞机。【原文：India has agreed to buy petroleum, defence goods, electronics, pharma and telecom products as well as aircraft from the U.S. under a trade deal, a government official told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 据消息人士透露，蒙太奇将以9.02亿美元的价格在香港上市，定价处于区间上限。
item.description: 知情人士透露，中国半导体设计公司蒙特吉科技将在香港上市定价区间上限进行定价，筹资额最高可达70.4亿港元（约合9.02亿美元）。【原文：Chinese semiconductor designer Montage Technology is set to price its Hong Kong listing at the top end of a range, raising as much as HK$7.04 billion ($902 million), two people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 澳大利亚两年内首次加息，市场押注五月将再升息
item.description: 澳大利亚央行周二上调基准政策利率，这是该行两年来的首次加息。央行表示，经济增长速度快于预期，通胀率在一段时间内可能持续高于目标水平。【原文：Australia's central bank on Tuesday raised its benchmark policy rate for the first time in two years, saying the economy was growing faster than expected and inflation was likely to remain above target for some time.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行预计通胀率将上升，即便在2026年加息两次的情况下亦是如此。
item.description: 悉尼2月3日（路透社）——澳大利亚央行周二上调了经济增长和通胀预期，同时警告经济活动已触及增长上限，需要再加息几次才能使经济回归平衡。【原文：SYDNEY, Feb 3 (Reuters) - Australia's central bank on Tuesday raised its forecasts for economic growth and inflation, warning that activity was hitting speed limits and a couple of increases in interest rates would be needed to bring it back into balance.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳洲航空将退出捷星日本业务，专注于国内航线运营
item.description: 澳洲航空周二宣布将出售旗下廉价航空捷星日本的股权，以专注于核心国内业务。这家澳大利亚国家航空公司正面临企业需求疲软和燃油成本上升的双重压力。【原文：Qantas Airways said on Tuesday it would sell its stake in low-cost carrier Jetstar Japan to focus on its core domestic offerings as the Australian flag carrier faces softer corporate demand and higher fuel costs.】
